<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<JSONObject> it = authors.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
JSONArray authorsArray = (JSONArray) jsonObject.get("authors");
for(int i = 0; i < authorsArray.length(); i++){
JSONObject authorNode = authorsArray.getJSONObject(i);
Author a = new Author(0, "", "");
a.setFirstName((String) authorNode.get("first_name"));
a.setLastName((String) authorNode.get("last_name"));
names.add(a);
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use a JSONArray to store the values of the JSONObjects in the iterator. Then, iterate through the JSONArray and extract the values for each Author object.
